channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-15922] DelegationTokenAuthenticationFilter get wrong doAsUser since it does not decode URL
item.description:
DelegationTokenAuthenticationFilter get wrong doAsUser when proxy user from client is complete kerberos name (e.g., user/hostname@REALM.COM, actually it is acceptable), because DelegationTokenAuthenticationFilter does not decode DOAS parameter in URL which is encoded by URLEncoder at client.
e.g. KMS as example:
a. KMSClientProvider creates connection to KMS Server using DelegationTokenAuthenticatedURL#openConnection.
b. If KMSClientProvider is a doAsUser, KMSClientProvider will put doas with url encoded user as one parameter of http request. 

    // proxyuser
    if (doAs != null) {
      extraParams.put(DO_AS, URLEncoder.encode(doAs, "UTF-8"));
    }

c. when KMS server receives the request, it does not decode the proxy user.

As result, KMS Server will get the wrong proxy user if this proxy user is complete Kerberos Name or it includes some special character. Some other authentication and authorization exception will throws next to it.
item.summary: DelegationTokenAuthenticationFilter get wrong doAsUser since it does not decode URL

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: submit v001 patch and trigger Jenkins. UT will follow later.

I am watching this but I don't know the code well enough to be able to review it -security code is one of those sensitive areas. Maybe lmccay could join in

w.r.t the tests, call UserGroupInformation.reset(); in setup and teardown methods; makes sure that UGI settings are picked up and then later don't hang around to break other tests.

hexiaoqiao Thank you for the patch. A few comments:

  1. Using foo/localhost is a good touch to show case that '/' character must be decoded to ensure the username is foo/localhost instead of foo%2Flocalhost.
  2. Proxyuser wildcard is same as no security and setting bad example for others that follows it. In the unit test, can we use non-wildcard proxyuser settings? hadoop.kms.proxyuser.client.users=foo/localhost@REALM.COM and hadoop.kms.proxyuser.client.hosts=localhost,host are more accurate to illustrate the test.
  3. Client principal should have hostname for correctness as a service principal. It looks like proxyuser credential isn't validating hostname with hadoop.kms.proxyuser.client.hosts. Something is still broken in validating service principal outside the scope of this JIRA.
  4. Test case method generally starts with test prefix. Recommend to rename doGetDelegationTokenByProxyUser to testGetDelegationTokenByProxyUser.

eyang, Thanks for your reviews and comments.
HADOOP-15922.003.patch update unit test based Eric's comments:
1. use proxy user named foo/localhost instead of foo/localhost@REALM.COM and just check special character '/'.
2. limit proxyuser scope about client.
3. I think it is not key point about client principal with/without hostname for this issue and principal is defined when setup at beginning, if I missed something, please correct me.
4. rename test method from doGetDelegationTokenByProxyUser to testGetDelegationTokenByProxyUser.
Thanks eyang again.

hexiaoqiao Thank you for the update. 

UserGroupInformation proxyUgi = UserGroupInformation.
+            loginUserFromKeytabAndReturnUGI("client", keytab.getAbsolutePath());
+        UserGroupInformation foo = UserGroupInformation.createProxyUser(
+            "foo/localhost", proxyUgi);

It would be better written as:

UserGroupInformation proxyUgi = UserGroupInformation.
+            loginUserFromKeytabAndReturnUGI("client/host", keytab.getAbsolutePath());
+        UserGroupInformation foo = UserGroupInformation.createProxyUser(
+            "foo/localhost", proxyUgi);

Although this change doesn't do anything to this test case, but it is better to show this example to prevent misleading people down the path that proxyUgi can work without a hostname designation.

eyang Thank you for quick response.
It makes sense for me. HADOOP-15922.004.patch fixes it. FYI.

+1 overall

hexiaoqiao If the client is changed to proxy from client/host, then hadoop.kms.proxyuser.client.hosts should include host:

+    conf.set("hadoop.kms.proxyuser.client.hosts", "localhost,host");

I am not sure why KMS doesn't use standard hadoop.proxyuser.client.groups and hadoop.proxyuser.client.hosts. It seems to let bugs slip through like client user origin is not validated, or the impersonating user doesn't belong to any primary group.

Do we want to open a bug that proxyuser origin is not validated for KMS?

Hi eyang

If the client is changed to proxy from client/host, then hadoop.kms.proxyuser.client.hosts should include host: conf.set("hadoop.kms.proxyuser.client.hosts", "localhost,host");

In the unit test, try to use user 'client/host' impersonate 'foo/localhost'. Actually, it is set for user 'client' about which users/groups/hosts can impersonate to, using configuration key 'hadoop.kms.proxyuser.client.users'/'hadoop.kms.proxyuser.client.hosts' and it is indeed valid. Impersonating user 'foo/localhost' can be passing auth since:

    conf.set("hadoop.kms.proxyuser.client.users", "foo/localhost");
    conf.set("hadoop.kms.proxyuser.client.hosts", "localhost");

It is not necessary to check groups if users can check pass, ref. org.apache.hadoop.security.authorize.AccessControlList#isUserInList

  public final boolean isUserInList(UserGroupInformation ugi) {
    if (allAllowed || users.contains(ugi.getShortUserName())) {
      return true;
    } else if (!groups.isEmpty()) {
      for (String group : ugi.getGroups()) {
        if (groups.contains(group)) {
          return true;
        }
      }
    }
    return false;
  }

I am not sure why KMS doesn't use standard hadoop.proxyuser.client.groups and hadoop.proxyuser.client.hosts.

Configuration prefix 'hadoop.kms' for KMS originate from HADOOP-10433, however I do not find why KMS use no-standard configuration.

hexiaoqiao The users list was changed to verify using shortname only in HADOOP-6634, which drops the validation of server designation. This means proxyuser credential validation hasn't worked as initially designed for 8 years now. The current patch is good without digging into past changes.

+1 from my point of view. I will keep this open for other security experts to check if we missed anything.
eyang Thank your for pushing forward this issue.
Thank you hexiaoqiao. I committed this issue to trunk, branch-3.2, and branch-3.1.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #15503 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/15503/)
HADOOP-15922. Fixed doAsUser decoding for (eyang: rev a9d96948ede11d4d8a8fb58b31b150af84e118d9)

  • (edit) hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/security/token/delegation/web/DelegationTokenAuthenticationFilter.java
  • (edit) hadoop-common-project/hadoop-kms/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/crypto/key/kms/server/TestKMS.java

I was asked to take a look at this patch. The problem is not on the server-side. The query strings params (before this patch) are already correctly decoded. The real problem is the client is double encoding in DelegationTokenAuthenticator#doDelegationTokenOperation.

// proxyuser
if (doAsUser != null) {
  params.put(DelegationTokenAuthenticatedURL.DO_AS,
      URLEncoder.encode(doAsUser, "UTF-8"));
}
[...a few lines later...]
for (Map.Entry<String, String> entry : params.entrySet()) {
  sb.append(separator).append(entry.getKey()).append("=").
      append(URLEncoder.encode(entry.getValue(), "UTF8"));
  separator = "&";
}

Please revert and remove the encoding of the DO_AS param when inserted in the map.
daryn Thank you for your correct. I upload another v005 and follow your suggestions.could you help to revert commit and review the new one. Thanks again.

daryn Good catch on the double encode. Thanks

hexiaoqiao Patch 005 is the better fix if we don't need to worry about rolling upgrade where the caller is using existing code. Is there a concern there? Thanks
+1. I don't see any compatibility concerns.
Reopen to test patch 005.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #15538 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/15538/)
HADOOP-15922. Revert patch 004. (eyang: rev 38ea3814bd0641d895e5d3b7415c6308e7f8491e)

  • (edit) hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/security/token/delegation/web/DelegationTokenAuthenticationFilter.java
  • (edit) hadoop-common-project/hadoop-kms/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/crypto/key/kms/server/TestKMS.java

If doAs=john/admin, the difference between patch 004 and 005 are:

Patch 004 will result in:

In flight value  Old Server New Server
Old Client (john%252Fadmin) john%2Fadmin john/admin
New Client (john%252Fadmin) john%2Fadmin john/admin

Patch 005 will result in:

 In flight value Old Server New Server
Old Client (john%252Fadmin) john%2Fadmin john%2Fadmin
New Client (john%2Fadmin) john/admin john/admin

If server store the old DO_AS user in database, it is an incompatible changes that server needs to handle the decoded values differently between new client and old client.  Mark this as incompatible change for precaution.

-1 overall

Patch 005 unit test is failing now due to revert of HADOOP-12751.  The auth_to_local rule needs to match in order to pass.  hexiaoqiao can you make adjustment to match daryn's fail on no matching rule design?  Thanks

eyang update and re-upload v006 and use special character '%' replace '/' in TestKMS#testGetDelegationTokenByProxyUser compare to v005. Since after revert of HADOOP-12751, have to config complex auth_to_local rules to pass the auth. In order to check client not double encode doAs user name only, choose another special character '%' and do not import auth_to_local rules. FYI.

hexiaoqiao it is a better example if the user is foo/localhost because this is a real format for kerberos principal, where foo%local is not.  daryn, without auth_to_local rule defined, the system act as pass through.  Hence, revert HADOOP-12751 is a moot point unless some other code is added to safe guard against no rule.  Otherwise, there is a discrepancy between your security mailing list proposal and no rule defined.  Is there a Jira for the second part of your proposal?

eyang Thanks for your feedback.
Actually, if use 'fool/localhost' as impersonate user for ut, KerberosName could not check pass after revert HADOOP-12751, since KerberosName#apply check if impersonate user name include '/' or '@' when apply rule like 'RULE:[2:$1/$2]', and it throws exception because HADOOP-12751.

if (result != null && nonSimplePattern.matcher(result).find())

Unknown macro: { throw new NoMatchingRule("Non-simple name " + result + " after auth_to_local rule " + this); }

Before revert HADOOP-12751, this check just LOG.info and not throw exception.
IIUC, this is a common issue: if using auth_to_local and some rule include '/' or '@', it always throw exception. FYI.

hexiaoqiao HADOOP-15996 is committed. This means the doAs parameter may contain username with @ character when multi-realms username can not be shorten. Can you adjust the test case to cover hadoop.security.auth_to_local.mechanism=mit and auth_to_local without DEFAULT rule?

eyang Thank you for pushing forward HADOOP-15996 and this issue.
update and upload v007 and adapt MIT auth_to_local mechanism based on HADOOP-15996.
